sentences.english: One of the Four Auspicious Animals. It can stop the evil things and improve the environment.
sentences.chinese: 为吉祥四瑞兽之一，其功效能挡蔽诸煞，改善风水。

sentences.english: Beat base on quarter have lucky pattern, among them what the front engraves is animal of lion body luck.
sentences.chinese: 鼓座基上刻有吉祥图案，其中正面刻的是狮形瑞兽。

sentences.english: One of the Four Auspicious Animals. It can stop evil things and improve your faculty of memory.
sentences.chinese: 吉祥四瑞兽之一，其功效能档蔽诸煞，改善记忆。

sentences.english: As symbols of peace and auspicious animals, elephants were often used in imperial rituals or ceremonies in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 象在古代是象征太平的瑞兽，朝仪中多所使用。

sentences.english: Jade Dragon did descend, blue badger offered its skin.
sentences.chinese: 玉龙曾下降，瑞兽献蓝皮。

sentences.english: One of the Four Auspicious Animals. It can stop the evil things and improve your environment.
sentences.chinese: 为吉祥四瑞兽之一，其功效能挡蔽诸煞，改善风水。

sentences.english: Jade Dragon did descend, badger offered its skin.
sentences.chinese: 玉龙曾下降，瑞兽献蓝皮。

sentences.english: It is generally regarded as benevolent, powerful, worshipful and lucky.
sentences.chinese: 龙一般被认为是瑞兽，拥有巨大的力量，尊贵，吉祥。

definition: mythical animal that brings luck and wards off evil, having head of a dragon and lion's body, often with hoofs, wings and tail/also written 辟邪/fig. valiant soldier
Luduan, mythical Chinese beast able to detect the truth

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
to ward off evil spirits/mythical lion-like animal that wards off evil (also called 貔貅[pi2 xiu1])
guardian lion, a lion statue traditionally placed at the entrance of Chinese imperial palaces, imperial tombs, temples etc
Longfeng district of Daqing city 大慶|大庆[Da4 qing4], Heilongjiang
decorated knob protruding from seal, allowing it to be strung on a cord
Bixi, one of the nine sons of a dragon with the form of a tortoise, also known as 龜趺|龟趺[gui1 fu1]
